data.name: DirectlyAwaitingTaskDescription
data.value: Do not directly await a Task

data.name: DirectlyAwaitingTaskMessage
data.value: Do not directly await a Task without calling ConfigureAwait

data.name: DontUseCodeActionCreateDescription
data.value: Do not use generic CodeAction.Create to create CodeAction

data.name: DontUseCodeActionCreateMessage
data.value: Consider creating unique code action type per different fix. it will help us to see how each code action is used. otherwise, we will only see bunch of generic code actions being used.

data.name: MissingSharedAttributeDescription
data.value: Parts exported with MEFv2 must be marked as Shared.

data.name: MissingSharedAttributeMessage
data.value: Part exported with MEFv2 must be marked with the Shared attribute.

data.name: MixedVersionsOfMefAttributesDescription
data.value: Do not mix attributes from different versions of MEF

data.name: MixedVersionsOfMefAttributesMessage
data.value: Attribute '{0}' comes from a different version of MEF than the export attribute on '{1}'

data.name: UseArrayEmptyDescription
data.value: Avoid zero-length array allocations.

data.name: UseArrayEmptyMessage
data.value: Avoid unnecessary zero-length array allocations. Use Array.Empty<T>() instead.

data.name: ImplementIEquatableDescription
data.value: Implement IEquatable<T> when overriding Object.Equals

data.name: ImplementIEquatableMessage
data.value: Type {0} should implement IEquatable<T> because it overrides Equals

data.name: OverrideObjectEqualsDescription
data.value: Override Object.Equals(object) when implementing IEquatable<T>

data.name: OverrideObjectEqualsMessage
data.value: Type {0} should override Equals because it implements IEquatable<T>

data.name: UseEmptyEnumerableDescription
data.value: Use SpecializedCollections.EmptyEnumerable<T>()

data.name: UseEmptyEnumerableMessage
data.value: Use SpecializedCollections.EmptyEnumerable<T>()

data.name: UseSingletonEnumerableDescription
data.value: Use SpecializedCollections.SingletonEnumerable<T>()

data.name: UseSingletonEnumerableMessage
data.value: Use SpecializedCollections.SingletonEnumerable<T>()

data.name: UseSiteDiagnosticsCheckerDescription
data.value: Invoke the correct property to ensure correct use site diagnostics.

data.name: UseSiteDiagnosticsCheckerMessage
data.value: Do not directly invoke the property '{0}', instead use '{0}NoUseSiteDiagnostics'.

data.name: UseProperCrefTagsDescription
data.value: Use of cref tags with prefixes should be avoided, since it prevents the compiler from verifying references and the IDE from updating references during refactorings. It is permissible to suppress this error at a single documentation site if the cref must use a prefix because the type being mentioned is not findable by the compiler. For example, if a cref is mentioning a special attribute in the full framework but you're in a file that compiles against the portable framework, or if you want to reference a type at higher layer of Roslyn, you should suppress the error. You should not suppress the error just because you want to take a shortcut and avoid using the full syntax.

data.name: UseProperCrefTagsMessage
data.value: cref tag has prefix '{0}', which should be removed unless the type or member cannot be accessed.

data.name: CancellationTokenMustBeLastDescription
data.value: CancellationToken parameters must come last

data.name: CancellationTokenMustBeLastMessage
data.value: Method '{0}' should take CancellationToken as the last parameter

data.name: DoNotCallToImmutableArrayMessage
data.value: Do not call ToImmutableArray on an ImmutableArray<T> value.

data.name: DiagnosticDescriptorAccessMessage
data.value: Do not invoke property '{0}' on type '{1}', instead directly access the required member{2} on '{1}'

data.name: DiagnosticDescriptorAccessTitle
data.value: Do not invoke Diagnostic.Descriptor

data.name: DiagnosticDescriptorAccessDescription
data.value: Accessing the Descriptor property of Diagnostic in compiler layer leads to unnecessary string allocations for fields of the descriptor that are not utilized in command line compilation. Hence, you should avoid accessing the Descriptor of the compiler diagnostics here. Instead you should directly access these properties off the Diagnostic type.

data.name: DoNotUseLinqOnIndexableCollectionMessage
data.value: Do not use Enumerable methods on indexable collections. Instead use the collection directly.

data.name: DoNotUseLinqOnIndexableCollectionDescription
data.value: This collection is directly indexable. Going through LINQ here causes unnecessary allocations and CPU work.

data.name: UseProperCrefTagsTitle
data.value: Avoid using cref tags with a prefix

data.name: ConsumePreserveSigTitle
data.value: Always consume the value returned by methods marked with PreserveSigAttribute

data.name: ConsumePreserveSigMessage
data.value: Consume the hresult returned by method '{0}' and call Marshal.ThrowExceptionForHR.

data.name: ConsumePreserveSigDescription
data.value: PreserveSigAttribute indicates that a method will return an HRESULT, rather than throwing an exception. Therefore, it is important to consume the HRESULT returned by the method, so that errors can be detected. Generally, this is done by calling Marshal.ThrowExceptionForHR.

data.name: DeclarePublicApiTitle
data.value: Add public types and members to the declared API

data.name: DeclarePublicApiMessage
data.value: Symbol '{0}' is not part of the declared API.

data.name: DeclarePublicApiDescription
data.value: All public types and members should be declared in PublicAPI.txt. This draws attention to API changes in the code reviews and source control history, and helps prevent breaking changes.

data.name: RemoveDeletedApiTitle
data.value: Remove deleted types and members from the declared API

data.name: RemoveDeletedApiMessage
data.value: Symbol '{0}' is part of the declared API, but is either not public or could not be found

data.name: RemoveDeletedApiDescription
data.value: When removing a public type or member the corresponding entry in PublicAPI.txt should also be removed. This draws attention to API changes in the code reviews and source control history, and helps prevent breaking changes.

data.name: UnusedDeclarationsCodeFixTitle
data.value: Remove unused code

data.name: UnusedDeclarationsMessage
data.value: '{0}' is not used in solution.
data.comment: The format-able message the diagnostic displays.

data.name: UnusedDeclarationsTitle
data.value: unused code

data.name: DoNotCreateTasksWithoutTaskSchedulerDescription
data.value: Do not create tasks unless you are using one of the overloads that takes a TaskScheduler. The default is to schedule on TaskScheduler.Current, which would lead to deadlocks. Either use TaskScheduler.Default to schedule on the thread pool, or explicitly pass TaskScheduler.Current to make your intentions clear.

data.name: DoNotCreateTasksWithoutTaskSchedulerTitle
data.value: Do not create tasks without passing a TaskScheduler

data.name: DoNotCreateTasksWithoutTaskSchedulerMessage
data.value: Do not call {0} without passing a TaskScheduler

data.name: SymbolDeclaredEventRuleTitle
data.value: SymbolDeclaredEvent must be generated for source symbols

data.name: SymbolDeclaredEventRuleMessage
data.value: Symbol '{0}' seems to be a source symbol, but neither the symbol nor any of it's base types invoke method '{1}.{2}' to register a symbol declared event.

data.name: SymbolDeclaredEventRuleDescription
data.value: Compilation event queue is required to generate symbol declared events for all declared source symbols. Hence, every source symbol type or one of it's base types must generate a symbol declared event.

data.name: ExposedNoninstantiableTypeDescription
data.value: When a base class is noninheritable because its constructor is internal, a derived class should not make it inheritable by having a public or protected constructor.

data.name: ExposedNoninstantiableTypeMessage
data.value: Constructor makes its noninheritable base class inheritable, thereby exposing its protected members.

data.name: ExposedNoninstantiableTypeTitle
data.value: Constructor make noninheritable base class inheritable

data.name: PublicApiFilesInvalid
data.value: The contents of the public API files are invalid: {0}
